gurmukhi: bhu brKn lau rwm jI rwj krw Ar twl ] bHmrMDR kh PorkY BXo kausilAw kwl ]841]
transliteration: Bahu Barkhan Lau Raam Jiraaj Karaa Ar Taal||brahmrandhra Kah Phorkai Bhayo Kaousaliaakaal||841||
translation: In this way, Ram ruled for a long time and on one day Kaushalya breathed her last on the bursting of her nerve Brahm-Randhra.841.

gurmukhi: jYs miRqk ky huqy pRkwrw ] qYsyeI kry byd Anuswrw ] rwm spUq jwihM Gr mwhI ] qwkhu qot koaU kh nwhI ]842]
transliteration: Jais Mritak Ke Houte Prakaaraa|| Taiseidare Bed Anousaaraa|| Raam Sapoot Jaahen Ghar Maahee|| Taakauh Tot Ko( i)  Kah Naahee||842||
translation: The ritual which is performed on the death of someone, the same was performed according to the Vedas; the benign son Ram went to the home (and himself being an incarnation) he had no shortage of any type.842.

gurmukhi: bhu ibiD giq kInI pRB mwqw ] qb lau BeI kYkeI swNqw ] qw ky mrq suimqRw mrI ] dyKhu kwl kiRAw ks krI ]843]
transliteration: Bahu Bidh(i) Gad(i) Keeniprabh Maataa|| Tab Lau Bhaikaikaisaantaa|| Taa Ke Marat Soumitraa Daree|| Dekhauh Kaal Kriaa Kas Daree||843||
translation: Many rituals were performed for the salvation of the mother and by that time Kaikeyi had also passed away. After her death, look at the doing of KAL (death). Sumitra also died.843.

gurmukhi: eyk idvs jwnik qiRX isKw ] BIq Bey rwvx kh ilKw ] jb rGubr iqh Awn inhwrw ] kCuk kop iem bcn aucwrw ]844]
transliteration: Eh Divas Jaanakitriya Sikhaa|| Bheet Bhae Raavan Kah Likhaa|| Jab Raghoubar Tih Aan Nihaaraa|| Kachhouk Kop Im Bachanndouchaaraa||844||
translation: One day explaining to women, Sita drew the portrait of Ravana on the wall, when Ram saw this, he said somewhat angrily.844.
Speed of Ram in his mind :

gurmukhi: Xw ko kCu rwvn so hoqw ] qw qy ic`qR icqRkY dyKw ] bcn sunq sIqw BeI roKw ] pRB muih AjhUM lgwvq doKw ]845]
transliteration: Yaa Ko Kachh(u) Raavan Ko Hetaa|| Taa Te Chittra Chitra-kai Dekhaa|| Bachanndsounat Seetaa Bhairokhaa|| Prabh Muh(i) Aj-hoon Lagadvat Dokhaa||845||
translation: She (Sita) must have had some love for Ravana, that is the reason why she is looking at his portrait drawn by her; Sita became angry on hearing these words and said that even then Ram had been accusing her.845.

gurmukhi: jau myry bc krm kir hiRdY bsq rGurwie ] piRQI pYNf muih dIjIAlIjY moih imlwie ]846]
transliteration: Jau Dere Bach Karam Kar(i) Hridai Basat Raghuraae|| Prithipaind Muh(i) Deejeeai Leejai Moh(i) Milaae||846||
translation: “If Ram the king Raghu clan abides ever in my heart, in my speech and action then, O mother earth ! you give me some place and merge me in yourself.”846.

gurmukhi: sunq bcn DrnI Pt geI ] lop sIAw iqh BIqr BeI ] c`kRq rhy inrK rGurweI ] rwj krn kI Aws cukweI ]847]
transliteration: Sounat Bachannddharniphat Gade|| Lop Seeaa Tih Bheetar Bhaee|| Chakkrat Rahe Nirakh Raghuraaee|| Raaj Karan Kiaas Choukaaee||847||
translation: Hearing these words the earth tore asunder and Sita merged in it; seeing this Ram wondered and in this suffering he ended all hope of ruling.847.

gurmukhi: ieh jg DUAro Daulhir ikh ky AwXo kwm ] rGubr ibnu sIA nw jIAY sIA ibn jIAY n rwm ]848]
transliteration: Eh Jag Dhodaro Dhaulhar(i) Kih Ke Aayo|| Raghoubar Bin(u) Seea Naa Jeeai Seea Bin Jeeai Na Raam||848||
translation: This world is the palace of smoke which had been of no value to anyone; Sita could not live without Ram and it is impossible for Ram to remain alive without Sita.848.
